description: If n=x1x2...xm in base 10, n belongs to the sequence iff x1x2..xm*11=y1y2...ym and xm..x2x1*11=ym...y2y1.
comments: This pattern works whenever the adjacent digits of a number do not add to more than 9.A059632(a(n)) = 11*a(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2014
references: D. Wells, Curious and interesting numbers, Penguin Books, p. 156
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (Haskell)a039691 n = a039691_list !! (n-1)a039691_list = filter (f 0) [0..] where   f d x = d' + d < 10 && (x < 10 || f d' x') where (x', d') = divMod x 10-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2014
author: _Felice Russo_
